intro: Campanula cephalaria var. polyanthemos, commonly known as the polyanthus bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It features upright stems that bear clusters of bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The leaves are lance-shaped and slightly hairy, contributing to its ornamental appeal. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade. This variety is prized for its showy blooms and is often used in garden landscaping.
